019package org.jgrapes.webconsole.base;
020
021import java.lang.ref.ReferenceQueue;
022import java.lang.ref.WeakReference;
023import java.time.Duration;
024import java.time.Instant;
025import java.util.Collections;
026import java.util.HashSet;
027import java.util.Locale;
028import java.util.Map;
029import java.util.Optional;
030import java.util.Set;
031import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap;
032import java.util.function.Supplier;
033import org.jgrapes.core.Channel;
034import org.jgrapes.core.Components;
035import org.jgrapes.core.Components.Timer;
036import org.jgrapes.core.EventPipeline;
037import org.jgrapes.core.Subchannel;
038import org.jgrapes.http.Session;
039import org.jgrapes.io.IOSubchannel;
040import org.jgrapes.io.IOSubchannel.DefaultIOSubchannel;
041import org.jgrapes.io.events.Closed;
042import org.jgrapes.io.util.LinkedIOSubchannel;
043
044/**
045 * The server side representation of a window in the browser 
046 * that displays a console page (a console session). An instance 
047 * is created when a new console window opens the WebSocket 
048 * connection to the server for the first time. If the 
049 * connection between the browser and the server is lost, 
050 * the console code in the browser tries to establish a 
051 * new WebSocket connection to the same, already
052 * existing {@link ConsoleSession}. The {@link ConsoleSession} 
053 * object is thus independent of the WebSocket connection 
054 * that handles the actual transfer of notifications.
055 * 
056 * ![WebConsole Session](ConsoleSession.svg)
057 * 
058 * Because there is no reliable way to be notified when a
059 * window in a browser closes, {@link ConsoleSession}s are
060 * discarded automatically unless {@link #refresh()} is called
061 * before the timeout occurs. Refresh messages are generated 
062 * by the SPA automatically if the session is idle, i.e. no
063 * data is sent due to user activity. To avoid having too many 
064 * open WebSockets with idle sessions, the maximum idle time
065 * can be configured with 
066 * {@link ConsoleWeblet#setConsoleSessionInactivityTimeout(Duration)}
067 * (see {@link ConsoleWeblet} for details}).
068 * 
069 * {@link ConsoleSession} implements the {@link IOSubchannel}
070 * interface. This allows the instances to be used as channels
071 * for exchanging console session scoped events with the 
072 * {@link WebConsole} component. The upstream channel
073 * (see {@link #upstreamChannel()}) is the channel of the
074 * WebSocket. It may be unavailable if the connection has
075 * been interrupted and not (yet) re-established.
076 * 
077 * The response {@link EventPipeline} must be used to send
078 * events (responses) to the console session in the browser.
079 * No other event pipeline may be used for this purpose, else
080 * messages will interleave.
081 * 
082 * Because a console session (channel) remains conceptually open
083 * even if the connection to the browser is lost (until the
084 * timeout occurs) {@link Closed} events from upstream are not
085 * forwarded immediately. Rather, a {@link Closed} event is
086 * fired on the channel when the timeout occurs. Method
087 * {@link #isConnected()} can be used to check the connection 
088 * state.
089 *  
090 * As a convenience, the {@link ConsoleSession} provides
091 * direct access to the browser session, which can 
092 * usually only be obtained from the HTTP event or WebSocket
093 * channel by looking for an association of type {@link Session}.
094 * 
095 * @startuml ConsoleSession.svg
096 * class ConsoleSession {
097 *  -{static}Map<String,ConsoleSession> consoleSessions
098 *  +{static}findOrCreate(String consoleSessionId, Manager component): ConsoleSession
099 *  +setTimeout(timeout: long): ConsoleSession
100 *  +refresh(): void
101 *  +setUpstreamChannel(IOSubchannel upstreamChannel): ConsoleSession
102 *  +setSessionSupplier(Session browserSessionSupplier): ConsoleSession
103 *  +upstreamChannel(): Optional<IOSubchannel>
104 *  +consoleSessionId(): String
105 *  +browserSession(): Optional<Session>
106 *  +locale(): Locale
107 *  +setLocale(Locale locale): void
108 * }
109 * Interface IOSubchannel {
110 * }
111 * IOSubchannel <|.. ConsoleSession
112 *
113 * ConsoleSession "1" *-- "*" ConsoleSession : maintains
114 * 
115 * package org.jgrapes.http {
116 *     class Session
117 * }
118 * 
119 * ConsoleSession "*" -up-> "1" Session: browser session
120 * @enduml
121 */
122@SuppressWarnings("PMD.LinguisticNaming")
123public final class ConsoleSession extends DefaultIOSubchannel {
124
125    private static Map<String, WeakReference<ConsoleSession>> consoleSessions
126        = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
127    private static ReferenceQueue<ConsoleSession> unusedSessions
128        = new ReferenceQueue<>();
129
130    private String consoleSessionId;
131    private final WebConsole console;
132    private final Set<Locale> supportedLocales;
133    private Locale locale;
134    private long timeout;
135    private final Timer timeoutTimer;
136    private boolean active = true;
137    private boolean connected = true;
138    private Supplier<Optional<Session>> browserSessionSupplier;
139    private IOSubchannel upstreamChannel;
140
141    /**
142     * Weak reference to session.
143     */
144    private static class SessionReference
145            extends WeakReference<ConsoleSession> {
146
147        private final String id;
148
149        /**
150         * Instantiates a new session reference.
151         *
152         * @param referent the referent
153         */
154        public SessionReference(ConsoleSession referent) {
155            super(referent, unusedSessions);
156            id = referent.consoleSessionId();
157        }
158    }
159
160    private static void cleanUnused() {
161        while (true) {
162            SessionReference unused = (SessionReference) unusedSessions.poll();
163            if (unused == null) {
164                break;
165            }
166            consoleSessions.remove(unused.id);
167        }
168    }
169
170    /**
171     * Lookup the console session (the channel)
172     * for the given console session id.
173     * 
174     * @param consoleSessionId the console session id
175     * @return the channel
176     */
177    /* default */ static Optional<ConsoleSession>
178            lookup(String consoleSessionId) {
179        cleanUnused();
180        return Optional.ofNullable(consoleSessions.get(consoleSessionId))
181            .flatMap(ref -> Optional.ofNullable(ref.get()));
182    }
183
184    /**
185     * Return all sessions that belong to the given console as a new
186     * unmodifiable set.
187     *
188     * @param console the console
189     * @return the sets the
190     */
191    public static Set<ConsoleSession> byConsole(WebConsole console) {
192        cleanUnused();
193        Set<ConsoleSession> result = new HashSet<>();
194        for (WeakReference<ConsoleSession> psr : consoleSessions.values()) {
195            ConsoleSession psess = psr.get();
196            if (psess != null && psess.console != null
197                && psess.console.equals(console)) {
198                result.add(psess);
199            }
200        }
201        return Collections.unmodifiableSet(result);
202    }
203
204    /**
205     * Lookup (and create if not found) the console browserSessionSupplier channel
206     * for the given console browserSessionSupplier id.
207     *
208     * @param consoleSessionId the browserSessionSupplier id
209     * @param console the console that this session belongs to
210     * class' constructor if a new channel is created, usually 
211     * the console
212     * @param supportedLocales the locales supported by the console
213     * @param timeout the console session timeout in milli seconds
214     * @return the channel
215     */
216    /* default */ static ConsoleSession lookupOrCreate(
217            String consoleSessionId, WebConsole console,
218            Set<Locale> supportedLocales, long timeout) {
219        cleanUnused();
220        return consoleSessions.computeIfAbsent(consoleSessionId,
221            psi -> new SessionReference(new ConsoleSession(
222                console, supportedLocales, consoleSessionId, timeout)))
223            .get();
224    }
225
226    /**
227     * Replace the id of the console session with the new id.
228     *
229     * @param newConsoleSessionId the new console session id
230     * @return the console session
231     */
232    /* default */ ConsoleSession replaceId(String newConsoleSessionId) {
233        consoleSessions.remove(consoleSessionId);
234        consoleSessionId = newConsoleSessionId;
235        consoleSessions.put(consoleSessionId, new SessionReference(
236            this));
237        connected = true;
238        return this;
239    }
240
241    private ConsoleSession(WebConsole console, Set<Locale> supportedLocales,
242            String consoleSessionId, long timeout) {
243        super(console.channel(), console.newEventPipeline());
244        this.console = console;
245        this.supportedLocales = supportedLocales;
246        this.consoleSessionId = consoleSessionId;
247        this.timeout = timeout;
248        timeoutTimer = Components.schedule(
249            tmr -> discard(), Duration.ofMillis(timeout));
250    }
251
252    /**
253     * Changes the timeout for this {@link ConsoleSession} to the
254     * given value.
255     * 
256     * @param timeout the timeout in milli seconds
257     * @return the console session for easy chaining
258     */
259    public ConsoleSession setTimeout(long timeout) {
260        this.timeout = timeout;
261        timeoutTimer.reschedule(Duration.ofMillis(timeout));
262        return this;
263    }
264
265    /**
266     * Returns the time when this session will expire.
267     *
268     * @return the instant
269     */
270    public Instant expiresAt() {
271        return timeoutTimer.scheduledFor();
272    }
273
274    /**
275     * Resets the {@link ConsoleSession}'s timeout.
276     */
277    public void refresh() {
278        timeoutTimer.reschedule(Duration.ofMillis(timeout));
279    }
280
281    /**
282     * Discards this session.
283     */
284    public void discard() {
285        consoleSessions.remove(consoleSessionId);
286        connected = false;
287        active = false;
288        console.newEventPipeline().fire(new Closed(), this);
289    }
290
291    /**
292     * Checks if the console session has become stale (inactive).
293     *
294     * @return true, if is stale
295     */
296    public boolean isStale() {
297        return !active;
298    }
299
300    /* default */ void disconnected() {
301        connected = false;
302    }
303
304    /**
305     * Checks if a network connection with the browser exists.
306     *
307     * @return true, if is connected
308     */
309    public boolean isConnected() {
310        return connected;
311    }
312
313    /**
314     * Provides access to the weblet's channel.
315     *
316     * @return the channel
317     */
318    public Channel webletChannel() {
319        return console.webletChannel();
320    }
321
322    /**
323     * Sets or updates the upstream channel. This method should only
324     * be invoked by the creator of the {@link ConsoleSession}, by default
325     * the {@link ConsoleWeblet}.
326     * 
327     * @param upstreamChannel the upstream channel (WebSocket connection)
328     * @return the console session for easy chaining
329     */
330    public ConsoleSession setUpstreamChannel(IOSubchannel upstreamChannel) {
331        if (upstreamChannel == null) {
332            throw new IllegalArgumentException();
333        }
334        this.upstreamChannel = upstreamChannel;
335        return this;
336    }
337
338    /**
339     * Sets or updates associated browser session. This method should only
340     * be invoked by the creator of the {@link ConsoleSession}, by default
341     * the {@link ConsoleWeblet}.
342     * 
343     * @param sessionSupplier the browser session supplier
344     * @return the console session for easy chaining
345     */
346    public ConsoleSession
347            setSessionSupplier(Supplier<Optional<Session>> sessionSupplier) {
348        this.browserSessionSupplier = sessionSupplier;
349        if (locale == null) {
350            locale = browserSession().locale();
351        }
352        return this;
353    }
354
355    /**
356     * @return the upstream channel
357     */
358    public IOSubchannel upstreamChannel() {
359        return upstreamChannel;
360    }
361
362    /**
363     * The console session id is used in the communication between the
364     * browser and the server. It is not guaranteed to remain the same
365     * over time, even if the console session is maintained. To prevent
366     * wrong usage, its visibility is therefore set to package. 
367     * 
368     * @return the consoleSessionId
369     */
370    /* default */ String consoleSessionId() {
371        return consoleSessionId;
372    }
373
374    /**
375     * @return the browserSession
376     */
377    public Session browserSession() {
378        return browserSessionSupplier.get().get();
379    }
380
381    /**
382     * Returns the supported locales.
383     *
384     * @return the set of locales supported by the console
385     */
386    public Set<Locale> supportedLocales() {
387        return supportedLocales;
388    }
389
390    /**
391     * Return the console session's locale. The locale is initialized
392     * from the browser session's locale.
393     * 
394     * @return the locale
395     */
396    public Locale locale() {
397        return locale == null ? Locale.getDefault() : locale;
398    }
399
400    /**
401     * Sets the locale for this console session.
402     *
403     * @param locale the locale
404     * @return the console session
405     */
406    public ConsoleSession setLocale(Locale locale) {
407        this.locale = locale;
408        return this;
409    }
410
411    /*
412     * (non-Javadoc)
413     * 
414     * @see java.lang.Object#toString()
415     */
416    @Override
417    public String toString() {
418        StringBuilder builder = new StringBuilder();
419        builder.append(Subchannel.toString(this));
420        Optional.ofNullable(upstreamChannel).ifPresent(upstr -> builder.append(
421            LinkedIOSubchannel.upstreamToString(upstr)));
422        return builder.toString();
423    }
424
425}
